before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fnpht","text":"Prepare a 20x oligo mix per the recipe in the materials section ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cu63","text":"This procedure provides instructions for detecting Mpox virus and human beta-globin using a laboratory developed fast-enabled PCR assay on a Quantstudio 7 real-time PCR instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ov8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a62m","text":"To address the 2022 Mpox virus (MPXV) outbreak a real-time PCR targeting TNF receptor gene (G2RG) as described in the Journal of Virological Methods 2010 publication by Li et al. (1) was assessed and multiplexed with human betaglobin as endogenous control. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g7bo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aj752","text":"In September 2022, the CDC released an alert on its Laboratory Outreach Communication System stating that three cases of Mpox were detected in California with a significant deletion in the TNF receptor gene. These cases were undetectable by the G2RG TNF-targeted qPCR (2). In response, a secondary MPXV target was required to multiplex with the existing G2RG target in order to detect any future cases with a TNF receptor deletion. Several targets were trialed and the MPXV GP113 gene was selected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3curi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eacbs","text":"This validation report presents the data supporting the use of a G2RG/GP113/HBG multiplex qPCR for the detection of Mpox virus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nfd5","text":"This procedure describes testing of extracted DNA. Sample extraction is not included.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cljrc","text":"Prepare PCR master mixes in a Clean Room. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3esl7","text":"Perform all manipulations of samples and DNA in a genomic level PCR laboratory","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: target detection of mpox virus, detecting mpox virus, mpox virus, mpxv gp113 gene, tnf receptor deletion, targeting tnf receptor gene, tnf receptor gene, enabled pcr assay, undetectable by the g2rg tnf, hbg multiplex qpcr for the detection, human betaglobin, g2rg tnf, human betaglobin as endogenous control, targeted qpcr, secondary mpxv target, existing g2rg target, mpxv, cases of mpox, hbg multiplex qpcr, mpox, g2rg target in order

status.info: This protocol is currently in use at British Columbia Centre for Disease Control Public Health Laboratory.

title: Dual-target detection of Mpox virus
